editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: THE Traveller's Song; Or, Pleaſant MEDITATIONS On the WAY.

q.p: I will Sing unto the Lord as long as I Live, and my Meditations of him ſhall be Sweet.
I will Muſe of the Works of thy Hands.

div.p: LONDON, Printed for the Author, and Sold by Thomas Parkhurſt at the Bible and Three Crowns in Cheapſide. 1699.

div.head: To His Moſt Excellent Majeſty, WILLIAM III. King of Great BRITAIN, France and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. This Small Treatiſe is moſt humbly Dedicated by,

opener.signed: Your Majeſties meaneſt Subject and Servant, George Liddell.

lg.l: WHEN I the Coronation ſee,
Of all the Flowers the Queen,
Makes me to praiſe that Noble Day,
That Crown our Illuſtrious KING.
When I the ORANGE Lilly ſee,
That pretty Flower ſo clear,
Makes me to mind the ORANGE fine,
Our Britiſh Crown do wear.
When I do the Sweet-William ſee,
That pretty Flower ſo fine,
Makes me to love our William Dear,
That is Great Britain's KING.
REader theſe Lines to bring to Light,
Did put me in a Terrer;
Yet hoping you'll be ſo kind to me,
As tell me of an Error;
When Time and Leiſure does permit,
I ſhall Correct them farther.
Indeed to bring them into Verſe,
I did as I am able;
But my deſign into the thing,
Is to make you look the Bible.
When I do ſee in moſt theſe Verſe,
I do begin the Line;
Yet turn the I unto thy ſelf,
And then thou mak'ſt it thine.

lg.head: I.
lg.l: O Why are we afraid of Man,
That's made of brittle Clay;
And does forget our Maker great,
Iſa. 51.Did Heaven and Earth Diſplay.

lg.head: II.
lg.l: O let us learn a publick ſpirit,
For good to Iſrael;
And when our Bodies laid in duſt,
Pſal. 112.Our Memory ſhall not fall.

lg.head: III.
lg.l: O let us live a Holy Life,
And ſtill therein proceed;
Tho' our beginning be but ſmall,
Heb. 12.As Grain of Muſtard Seed.

lg.head: IV.
lg.l: O flee from ſin that is ſo evil,
And cauſeth Judgments fa;
Us to Redeem, the Lord of Life,
John 19.Did ſuffer at Golgotha.

lg.head: V.
lg.l: O let your Light before the World,
In ſhining ſo excell,
That others ſeeing your Holy Life,
Phil. 2.May glorifie God themſel.

lg.head: VI.
lg.l: When I have been in ſtraits ſo great,
My ſpirits almoſt ſink't,
Yet God moſt high hath given to me,
A faithful loving blink.

lg.head: VII.
lg.l: When I do Travel far and near,
For this my daily Bread;
Makes me to mind the Travels ſore,
Iſa. 53.That Chriſt had for his Seed.

lg.head: VIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sower Sow,
And makes his Caſts ſo meet,
Makes me to mind our Sower high,
Acts 10.Reveal'd by Peter's Sheet.

lg.head: IX.
lg.l: When I do hear the Thunder loud,
Sees Fire tear the Sky,
Makes me to mind Jehovah's Voice,
Pſal. 29.So loud to Men doth cry.

lg.head: X.
lg.l: When I the Glorious Sun do ſee,
Each Day his Race fulfil,
Makes me to mind great Joſhua's Day,
Joſh. 10.When it ſo long ſtood ſtill.

lg.head: XI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the godly kind,
I love them with my heart.
Makes me to long to meet in Heaven,
Where we ſhall never part.

lg.head: XII.
lg.l: When we do fall in troubles great,
Sees ſtraits before our Een,
Let us then mind that Providence,
Gen. 22.On Mount it ſhall be ſeen.

lg.head: XIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Bull-ruſh ſtrong,
Grows by the River's ſide,
Makes me to mind that Ark of them
Exod. 2.Did Moſes in Nilus hide.

lg.head: XIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Vine ſo Red,
And Grapes that's in my Hand,
Makes me to mind that Cluſter fine,
Num. 13.They brought from Canaan's Land.

lg.head: XV.
lg.l: When I behold the Rainbow Red,
With Colours Blue and Green,
Makes me to mind that Covenant,
Gen. 9.That God has made with Men.

lg.head: XVI.
lg.l: When I am daub'd in Clay ſo deep,
And all my Joints ſo ſore,
Makes me to love that Eternal Day,
Heb. 4.I'll reſt for ever more.

lg.head: XVII.
lg.l: When I behold the Lamb ſo young,
And Pleaſantly to play,
Makes me to mind that Immaculate Lamb,
John 1.That takes my Sins away.

lg.head: XVIII.
lg.l: O let us thankful be to God,
And walk into his way,
Who from the womb has fed and cled
Pſal. 22.Us to this very day.

lg.head: XIX.
lg.l: When I do mind that Joſeph young,
They laid for him ſuch Plots;
How he did ſuffer Innocently,
Gen. 39.At loſs of both his Coats.

lg.head: XX.
lg.l: When I that fervent Jacob mind,
Wreſtling in the Night,
Before the Day appeared clear,
Gen. 32.He got a Glorious ſight.

lg.head: XXI.
lg.l: When I do fall in Ditches deep,
As I do walk the Moors,
Prov. 23.27.Makes me to mind our Gallantries,
When they fall in with Whores.

lg.head: XXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Light at Morn,
Begin for to diſplay,
Makes me to mind the Upright's Light,
Like Noon-tide of the Day.

lg.head: XXIII.
lg.l: When I do mind that Sodom great,
Where was ſo many Men,
Makes me to admire my God ſo kind,
Gen. 18.Would ſav't if Righteous Ten.

lg.head: XXIV.
lg.l: When I hear the Trumper ſound,
Sees People in a Crowd,
Makes me mind Mount Sina right,
Exod. 19.When it did ſound ſo loud.

lg.head: XXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Thorns ſo thick,
As I do walk the way,
Makes me to mind how they ſpring up,
Matth. 13.And choaks the Seed away.

lg.head: XXVI.
lg.l: To know how Moon doth wax and wein,
It is above our Reaſons,
But let us glorifie our God,
Pſal. 104.Appointed her for Seaſons.

lg.head: XXVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Froſt and Snow,
So thick on Earth ro lye,
Makes me to mind thoſe Treaſures great,
Job 37.That's in the Heavens high.

lg.head: XXVIII
lg.l: When I do walk ſo dark at Night,
And cannot ſee my way,
Makes me to mind that darkneſs great,
Exod. 10.That was in Pharaoh's Day.

lg.head: XXIX.
lg.l: When I the pleaſant Larks hear Sing,
By Dawning of the Days,
Makes me to mind thoſe Glorious Heavens,
Where Saints do Sing always.

lg.head: XXX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Corn ſo ripe,
And Shearers that's ſo keen,
Makes me to mind that truth ſo right,
Ruth 2.When Ruth with Boaz did glean.

lg.head: XXXI.
lg.l: When I do meet with kindneſs ſweet,
That's Shown to me from Man,
Makes me to mind that Love ſo great,
2 Sam. 1.Of David and Jonathan.

lg.head: XXXII.
lg.l: When I the Glave ſtones do ſee,
Above the Saints that lye.
Makes me to mind the Souls above,
That's in Eternity.

lg.head: XXXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Carpenters,
To work in Oak ſo ſtark,
Makes me to mind our Noah old,
Gen. 6.How he did build the Ark.

lg.head: XXXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee a Furnace hot,
Would burn both Bone and Lyre,
Makes me to mind thoſe Children Three
Dan. 3.That were not hurt by Fire.

lg.head: XXXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Worms ſo thick,
That's in the Earth all over,
Makes me to mind my Bed of Duſt,
Job 19.When they me all ſhall cover.

lg.head: XXXVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Stones in Slings,
That throweth them ſo far,
Makes me to mind 700 Men,
Judg. 20.That threw them to a Hair.

lg.head: XXXVII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Sectaries,
With their Opinions faſs,
Makes me to think thoſe words mon wiſe
Num. 22.That ſpoke by Balaam's Aſs.

lg.head: XXXVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee our Dyars fine,
So caſt their Colours af,
Makes me to mind his Garments Red,
Iſa. 63.That came from Bozarach.

lg.head: XXXIX.
lg.l: When we do ſee the godly Rare,
With Sin and Trouble meet,
Yet let us mind the Day to come,
Iſa. 33.They ſhall not ſay I'm Sick.

lg.head: XL.
lg.l: When I the Mure-burn ſee ſo large,
And Fire to ſpread it ſell,
Makes me to mind that Flame ſo great
The Damned's in in Hell.

lg.head: XLI.
lg.l: When I behold the Willow Trees,
And Palms that grow thereon,
Makes me to mind thoſe Children dear,
Pſal. 137.That hang their Harps upon.

lg.head: XLII.
lg.l: When we do mind poor Ephraim,
And his unturned Cake,
Yet let us love thoſe mercies Bowels,
Hoſ. 11.Did freely for him ake.

lg.head: XLIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Gade ſo long,
That does our Ploughs ſo call,
Makes me to mind that Hand ſo ſtrong,
Judg. 3.By it made Philiſtines fall.

lg.head: XLIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Guils ſo thick,
Our Corn ſo overthrow,
Makes me to mind thoſe Firebrands,
Judg. 15.Set Philiſtines Fields a low.

lg.head: XLV.
lg.l: When I do mind the Heart's Zeal,
When Moſes brake the Tables,
Makes me to thank my God ſo kind,
Exod. 32.Renew'd them unto Rebels.

lg.head: XLVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Morning's Dew,
And all his Drops like Pearl,
Makes me to mind that Hermon's Dew,
Pſul. 133.Or on Sion Hill that fell.

lg.head: XLVII.
lg.l: When I do mind that Plot ſo great,
In Aſuerus Days,
When Haman's mind was fully bent,
Eſter 3.All the poor Jews to ſlay.

lg.head: XLVIII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Lion Roar,
And ſees his Paws ſo tear,
Makes me to mind that Lion ſtrong,
Rev. 5.That guarded me from fear.

lg.head: XLIX.
lg.l: When I do hear the Maevies ſing,
And warble forth her Notes
Makes me to praiſe Emanuel King,
Without my Book or Notes.

lg.head: L.
lg.l: When I ſee neither Sun nor Moon,
Nor Stars gliſtering high,
Yet I'll believe to ſee my King
Pſal. 45.Of Glory Eternally.

lg.head: LI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Rivers ſwell,
Into ſo great a flood,
Makes me to h •• d thoſe waters all
Exod. 7.Of Egypt's turn'd to blood.

lg.head: LII.
lg.l: When I have ſeen the godly Rare.
In Dark and Gloomy Days,
Yet I will mind the Hand ſo ſtrong,
Dan. 5.Thir lives in all their ways.

lg.head: LIII.
lg.l: O who art thou Goliah great,
That does defie the Heaven,
The Staff that in thy Hand thou wears,
Is like a Weaver's Beam,
1 Sam. 17.Ere long my Foot thy Neck ſhall tread,
And pull out both thy Een.

lg.head: LIV.
lg.l: When I a pleaſant River ſee,
And all her Streams to gleid,
Makes me to long that River ſee,
Pſal. 46.Whoſe Streams makes Saints ſo glad.

lg.head: LV.
lg.l: When I the Milk-white Roſe do pluck,
How pleaſant does it ſmell,
Makes me to mind thoſe long White Robes,
Rev. 7.Delivers Saints from Hell.

lg.head: LVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Hail ſo thick,
From Heaven to Earth fell,
Makes me to mind it Showers ſo great,
Joſhua 10.That did the Amorites quell.

lg.head: LVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Blaver Blue,
That grows amongſt the Corn,
Makes me to mind its Colour fine,
Exod 39.About the Ephod worn.

lg.head: LVIII.
lg.l: When I do drink the Populent Spring,
And Streams that are ſo fine,
Makes me to long to ſee that Day,
I's drink my Father's Wine.

lg.head: LIX.
lg.l: When I behold the Peacock proud,
And his Oriental Train,
Makes me to mind thoſe glorious Robes
Joh 39.That Saints do wear in Heaven.

lg.head: LX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sectaries,
That will not preſs the mark,
Yet I am ſure their Dagon ſtill,
Phil. 3.Shall fall before the Ark.

lg.head: LXI.
lg.l: When I a Garden fair do ſee,
And all her Flowers ſo fine,
Makes me lament my Parents firſt,
Gen. 3. Such Paradice did tyne.

lg.head: LXII.
lg.l: When I the Roſe ſo Red do ſee,
And all her Leaves ſo fine,
Makes me to love that Sharon's Roſe,
Cant. 2.That takes away my Sin.

lg.head: LXIII.
lg.l: When I behold the Woods ſo green,
And all her Birds hears Chants,
Makes me to long to ſee that Day,
2 Theſſ. 1.I Sing in Heaven with Saints,

lg.head: LXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Shaves ſo thick,
That ſtands on Ridges ſo even,
Makes me to mind that Emblem right,
Gen. 37.Of Joſeph and his Dream.

lg.head: LXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Wine ſo Red,
That in the Cup they fill,
Makes me to mind my Savior kind,
For me his Blood did ſpill.

lg.head: LXVI.
lg.l: When I our Sword ſo fine do ſee,
And Barrs with Yellow Gold,
Makes me to mind how Magiſtrates
2 Sam. 23.Should for the Truth be bold.

lg.head: LXVII.
lg.l: When we behold the Gold Spinkgay,
With Colours deck'd ſo fine,
Should we not ſpread our Maker's praiſe,
On things that are Divine.

lg.head: LXVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Ravens ſo ſtout,
And nothing laid in ſtore,
Makes me to mind their proviſor,
Luke 12.That Rings for evermore.

lg.head: LXIX.
lg.l: Though I be weary, and ſo vex't,
With this my daily Sin,
Yet I'll believe that glorious Day,
Rev. 21.When none ſhall Enter in.

lg.head: LXX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Fiſhers King,
That pretty Bird ſo gay,
Makes me Rejoice in God my King,
Job 33.Created me of Clay.

lg.head: LXXI.
lg.l: When I do hear the Harp ſo clear,
And pleaſantly to play,
Makes me to mind that Player fine,
1 Sam. 16. David in Saul's Day.

lg.head: LXXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Wood ſo gay,
So Glorious and Green,
Makes me to long to ſee that Day,
Heb. 4.I's reſt with Chriſt in Heaven.

lg.head: LXXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the cruelty,
That Men to other ſhows,
Makes me to mind Adonibezek right,
Judg. 1.With his Kings Thumbs and Toes.

lg.head: LXXIV.
lg.l: When I do mind that Dalilah,
Brought Sampſon mickle ſtrife,
Made him to loſe his precious Eyes,
Judg. 16.And likewiſe his ſweet life.

lg.head: LXXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Lamps at Night,
That lets me ſee to Gang,
Makes me to mind that Stratagem,
Judg. 7.Of Gideen to Midian.

lg.head: LXXVI.
lg.l: When I do meet the Brambles thick,
That hath my Cloaths ſo riven,
Makes me to mind that Man ſo proud,
Judg. 9. Abimelech the King.

lg.head: LXXVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Milſtone run,
Within its Circle full,
Makes me to mind how piece of one,
Judg. 9.Did break Ablmelech's Scull.

lg.head: LXXVIII.
lg.l: When I do mind that Sampſon ſtrong,
Which brought ſuch things to paſs,
How he did kill a Thouſand Men,
Judg. 15.With Jaw-bone of an Aſs.

lg.head: LXXIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Stars ſo bright,
And part of them down fa,
Makes me to mind how in their Courſe,
Judg. 5.They fought 'gainſt Siſera.

lg.head: LXXX.
lg.l: When I do ſee thoſe Chariots,
So in their going fine,
Makes me to mind how Siſera,
Judg. 4.That had 900 Iron.

lg.head: LXXXI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Dung ſo thick-
That lies upon the Land,
Makes me to mind the Jabin great,
Pſal. 83.That fell at Kiſhan Strand.

lg.head: LXXXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Rocks ſo high,
Upon the Earth that ſtands,
Makes me to mind thoſe Chriſlians wiſe,
Matth. 7.That does not build on Sands.

lg.head: LXXXIII.
lg.l: When I do mind that Eſther fine.
Came to the King in Silk,
Makes me admire the Woman wiſe,
Judg. 4.Fed Siſera with Milk.

lg.head: LXXXIV.
lg.l: When I the Fire large do ſee,
And all to Aſhes turn,
Makes me to mind the Fire great,
2 Pet. 3.When God the Earth ſhall burn.

lg.head: LXXXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Coal-pits burn,
That does the Earth ſo Tear,
Makes me to mind the dreadful Day,

Of Cor, Dathan,
Numb. 16. and Abier.

lg.head: LXXXVI.
lg.l: When I do hear how Zion dear,
with Moans Lament her ſel,
Yet I will mind her Palaces,
Pſal. 48.Where God delights to dwell.

lg.head: LXXXVII
lg.l: When I do hear the Frogs ſo croak,
In Water in the Even,
Makes me to mind the Plague of them,
Exod. 8.That fell on Egypt's King.

lg.head: LXXXVIII.
lg.l: When I conſider David young,
Whom Samuel a Shepherd fond,
And ſet a Crown upon his Head,
1 Sam. 16.For to Govern the Land.

lg.head: LXXXIX.
lg.l: When I do mind the Whale ſo big.
That Jonah brought to Land,
Makes me admire that Providence,
Jonah 2.Of my Redeemer's Hand.

lg.head: XC.
lg.l: When I do hear the People Lye,
And Feed themſelves with Sin,
Makes me to mind poor Ephraim,
Hoſ. 12.That Fed himſelf with Wind.

lg.head: XCI.
lg.l: When I the Candle-light do ſee,
And Butter-flies burn themſel,
Makes me to mind the wicked right,
That Dance in Sin to Hell.

lg.head: XCII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Corn ſo thick,
That on the Earth do grow,
Makes me to mind that increaſe great,
Gen. 26.That did on Iſaac flow.

lg.head: XCIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Barley thick,
And Hail fall on the Land,
Makes me to mind that Plague of it,
Exod. 9.That fell on Egypt's Land.

lg.head: XCIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Morning Cloud,
And Dew ſo paſs away,
Makes me to mind that ſad Complaint,
Hoſ. 6.Of Ephraim in Juda's Day.

lg.head: XCV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Brick kilns burn,
As I do walk the way,
Makes me to mind that Bondage great,
Exod. 5.Of Iſrael in Pharaoh's Day.

lg.head: XCVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Mountains great,
That ſtands on Cheviot Fells,
Makes me to mind their Maker great,
Iſa. 4.That weighed them in Scales.

lg.head: XCVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sea ſo rough,
And all her Waves like Fire,
Makes me to mind the Sea ſo Red,
Exod. 14.Did Pharaoh's Chariots tire.

lg.head: XCVIII.
lg.l: When I do walk the way with Saints,
So pleaſantly all out,
Makes me to mind that Joſeph kind,
Who ſaid, Gen. 45. do not fall out.

lg.head: XCIX.
lg.l: When I behold the pleaſant Earth,
So Beautiful and Green,
Makes me to mind that pleaſure great,
Rev. 21.That Saints enjoy in Heaven.

lg.head: C.
lg.l: When I the Play-Houſe ſee ſo fair,
With all her ſumptuous fillers,
Makes me to mind that Emblem right,
Judg. 16.When Sampſon pulled the Pillars.

lg.head: I.
lg.l: WHEN I the pleaſant Lilly ſee,
And all their Stalks ſo tall,
Makes me to mind that Promiſe great,
Hoſ. 14.Of God to Iſrael.

lg.head: II.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Scepter fine,
That does our Law ſo ſway,
Makes me to mind that Promiſe great,
Gen. 49.Of Shiloh in Juda's Day.

lg.head: III.
lg.l: When I the Ram ſee Bitter ſight,
And hears their Horns ſo ſnell,
Makes me to mind that Blaſt of them,
Joſhua 6.When Jericho's Walls down fell.

lg.head: IV.
lg.l: When I the flakes on Roofs do ſee,
Our Countrey People dries,
Makes me to mind that Rachab right,
Joſhua 2.Where ſhe did hide the Spies.

lg.head: V.
lg.l: When I the Covetous Worldling ſee,
And no Truth in his way,
Makes me to mind that Judas right,
John 18.That did his Lord betray.

lg.head: VI.
lg.l: When I do hear the Birds in Cage,
So pleaſantly to Sing,
Makes me to mind great Babylon,
Rev. 18.That was a Cage of Sin.

lg.head: VII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Arguments,
That the blind World do ſhow,
Yet I did know a Man in Chriſt,
2 Cor. 12.Above Fourteenth ago.

lg.head: VIII.
lg.l: When I do mind that Moſes great,
Did Egypt's wealth deſpiſe,
And to the Recompence of Reward,
Heb. 11.Did wholly ſet his Eyes.

lg.head: IX.
lg.l: Abel has been 5000 years in Heaven,
And Glory yet to come,
When he has been a Million of Millions more,
It's but as new begun.
I'll throw away my Quill,
Gen. 4.Such Compting's paſs my skill.

lg.head: X.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Shepherds thick,
As I do walk the Land,
Makes me to mind thoſe Patriarchs great,
Gen. 46.That dwelt in Goſhen's Land.

lg.head: XI.
lg.l: When I do drink the waters ſweet,
It's to my Nature kind,
Makes me to mind my Saviour dear,
John 2.That turn'd it into Wine.

lg.head: XII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Corn ſo thin,
And that it is ſo blawn,
Makes me to mind that Famine great,
Gen. 42.That fell on Canaan's Land.

lg.head: XIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Hunter fierce,
Purſue his Chaſe ſo bold,
Makes me to mind that Hunter great,
Gen. 10.Which Nimrod was of old.

lg.head: XIV.
lg.l: When I am hungry and hard ſted,
I do forget to Sing,
Yet I will mind Emanuel,
Matth. 1.My Everlaſting King.

lg.head: XV.
lg.l: When I do hear the Bells ſo loud,
And pleaſantly to Ring,
Makes me to mind the glorious Day,
That Chriſt ſhall Reign as King.

lg.head: XVI.
lg.l: Are not the Ravens fed, great God, by thee!
And wilt thou cloath the Lilies, and n •• me
I'll ne'er miſtruſt my God for Cloath and Bread,
Luke 12.While Lilies flouriſh, and Ravens feed

lg.head: XVII.
lg.l: When I thoſe pretty Birds do hear,
So pleaſantly to Sing,
Shall I not warble forth the Praiſe,
of my Eternal King.

lg.head: XVIII.
lg.l: When I hear the Kine ſo low,
At Even when it is dark,
Makes me to mind the Philiſtines Kine,
1 Sam. 6.That did bring home the Ark.

lg.head: XIX.
lg.l: When I conſider the Sparrows young,
And Hairs that▪s on my Head,
Makes me believe on God my King,
Matth. 10.When I am ſcarce of Bread.

lg.head: XX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Dew ſo thick,
That covers all Earth's Face,

Makes me to mind that Dew from He •
ven
Judg. 6.That wet all Gideon's Fleece.

lg.head: XXI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Greyhound fair,
That every thing out-runs,
Makes me to mind my time ſo ſwift,
That to Eternity turns.

lg.head: XXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Droves of Beaſts,
All going to be Slain,
Makes me to mind our gracious God,
How he provides for Men.

lg.head: XXIII.
lg.l: When I am by the Nettle ſtung,
And Blurs upon my Skin,
Makes me afraid that Pitch to touch,
Defiles my Soul with Sin.

lg.head: XXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Riſing Sun,
With all his Glorious Beams,
Makes me to love that Righteous Son,
Malach. 3.With Healing under his Wings.

lg.head: XXV.
lg.l: When I behold the Falcon fly,
And Steers her Courſe ſo even,
Makes me to mind Eliſha bright,
2 King. 2.In Chariot went to Heaven.

lg.head: XXVI.
lg.l: When I do mind Othniel ſtout,
That fought ſo for a Wife,
When he deſtroyed Debir ſtrong,
Judg. 1.That might coſt him his life.

lg.head: XXVII.
lg.l: When I the tired Shearers ſee,
Do hardly lift their Hook,
Makes me to mind that Harveſt great,
Mat. 9.Few Labourers has to work.

lg.head: XXVIII.
lg.l: When I the Fig leaves ſees ſo broad,
That pleaſant are and Green,
Makes me to mind our Cloaths at firſt,
Gen. 3.Of neither Silk nor Seam.

lg.head: XXIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Ocean deep,
With all her Banks of Sand,
Makes me to mind Jehovah high,
Iſa. 40.That meaſures her in his Hand.

lg.head: XXX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Flock ſo thick,
That's on bare Commons fed,
Makes me to mind the Flock of Ch ••
By World no better ſped.

lg.head: XXXI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Chariots,
That's in ſo fine attire,
Makes me to mind Eliſha's Guard,
2 King. 6.Thoſe Chariots of Fire.

lg.head: XXXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Archers ſhute,
And Bows abiding ſtrength,
Makes me to mind our Joſeph right,
Gen. 49.Whoſe Arms abode in ſtrength.

lg.head: XXXIII.
lg.l: When we have Eaten and are full,
Of what is in our Hand,
Let us be thankful unto God,
Deut. 8.That gave this plenty Land.

lg.head: XXXIV.
lg.l: When I our pretty Children ſee,
With Coats of divers Colour,
Makes me to mind our Joſeph right,
Gen. 37.Who had juſt ſuch another.

lg.head: XXXV.
lg.l: When I Sun, Moon and Stars do ſee,
So glorious in the Heavens,
Makes me to mind our Joſeph right,
Gen. 37.With all his Noble Dreams.

lg.head: XXXVI.
lg.l: When I that Reuben right do mind,
A tender hearted Brother,
Should we not Loving Chriſtians be,
Gen. 37.Preſerving one another.

lg.head: XXXVII.
lg.l: 〈◊〉 how doth the hunted Hart,
For Water Pant and Bray,
〈◊〉 was our David for his God,
Pſal. 42.When hunted in Saul's Day.

lg.head: XXXVIII.
lg.l: When I did drink the Water ſweet,
That comes from Jacob's Well,
Makes me to love that great Reward,
Matth. 22.That Jacob got himſel.

lg.head: XXXIX.
lg.l: When I the light at Morn do ſee,
Come in the Window clear,
Makes me to mind how light of Saints,
Matth. 5.Ought to the World appear.

lg.head: XL.
lg.l: When I do mind great Joſhua,
With God ſuch favour fand,
As to poſſeſs him fairly in,
Deut. 1.Into that Canaan's Land.

lg.head: XLI.
lg.l: When I obſerve the Sabbath-day,
To my Eternal King,
Makes me to mind that Sabbath ſtill,
Iſa. 58.That Saints enjoy in Heaven.

lg.head: XLII.
lg.l: When I do hear our Miniſters,
Thoſe Goſpel-Tydings tell,
Makes me to mind Jehovah high,
Exod. 20.That ſpoke them firſt himſel.

lg.head: XLIII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Pſalm ſo loud,
Praiſing Jehovah King,
Makes me to long to ſee that Day,
When Saints ſhall Praiſe and Sing.

lg.head: XLIV.
lg.l: When I behold the Promiſes great,
And on them caſt my Eye,
I think not much that Angels make it▪
1 Pet. 1.Their delight to pry.

lg.head: XLV.
lg.l: When I do lye on Cheviot Hills,
All Night among the Heather,
Makes me to mind that Bethel right,
Gen. 28.And Jacob with his Ladder.

lg.head: XLVI.
lg.l: When I the Yellow Yalderon ſeen,
That pretty Bird ſo fine,
Makes me to mind Jehovah great,
Gen. 2.Created every kind.

lg.head: XLVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Birds in Neſts,
So curiouſly to breed,
Makes me to mind my Saviour dear,
Luk. 9.Knew not to lay his Head.

lg.head: XLVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Garden fair.
And Flowers ſo pleaſant in,
Makes me to mind that Paradice,
Where firſt began our Sin.

lg.head: XLIX.
lg.l: Hoſanna's high Jeruſalem,
Your King comes on an Aſs,
With all thoſe Palm-trees in your Hands▪
John 12.The way that he is to paſs.

lg.head: L.
lg.l: When I do feel that pleaſant ſmell,
The Balm has under ſhade,
Makes me to mind that Balm ſo fine,
Gen. 37.That came from Gilead.

lg.head: LI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Stone ſo ſwift,
That from the Sling proceed,
Makes me to mind how deep it ſunk,
1 Sam. 17.Into Goliah's Head.

lg.head: LII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Ax ſo ſharp,
That cuts the Wood ſo green,
Makes me to mind Eliſha right,
2 King. 6.That cauſed Iron to ſwim.

lg.head: LIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Dew ſo thick,
Upon the Graſs that's mowen,
Makes me to mind the Duty right,
Pſal. 72.That Magiſtrates are owing.

lg.head: LIV.
lg.l: When I do mind Electing Chains,
In Romans Eight that be,
Wiſh God may ſhew me the firſt Link,
Rom. 8.The reſt will come to me.

lg.head: LV.
lg.l: Make haſte Zacheus, and climb the Tree,
By comes Zion's King,
Which to thy Houſe Salvation,
Luk. 19.This Day ſhall freely bring.

lg.head: LVI.
lg.l: When I do hear a Flatterer,
For all his pleaſant words,
Yet I will mind his Tales to me,
Pſal. 55.Is like to Drawn Swords.

lg.head: LVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Worldly proud,
And no good in their mean,
I think they're as great Fools to ſee,
Jerem. 7.As Cokers to the Queen of Heaven.

lg.head: LVIII.
lg.l: When I thoſe Heads ſo high do ſee,
Our Female Sex do wear,
Makes me to think the Judgment-Day▪
Iſa. 3.16.Should make them all to fear.

lg.head: LIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee them Patch and Paine▪
That does their Face ſo tear,
Makes me to mind the ſad lament,

Of Judah,
Jer. 4. tho' they wear.

lg.head: LX.
lg.l: When I unthankful Men do ſee,
Fed in our Land ſo thick,
Makes me to mind Jeſurun right,
Deut. 32.When he with fat did kick.

lg.head: LXI.
lg.l: When we do hear Idolaters,
For all their fair pretence,
Yet let us look the Scripture clear,
Deut. 13,It's wholly our defence.

lg.head: LXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee Idolaters,
At their Devotion falſe,
Makes me to mind Jeroboam ſo clear,
1 King. 12.His Dan and Bethel's Calves.

lg.head: LXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Kine ſo fat,
That's fed on Meadows green,
Makes me to mind that Emblem right,
Gen. 41.Of Pharaoh with his Dream.

lg.head: LXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Smoke ſo thick,
That from the Chimney fly,
Makes me to mind how Smoke of Sin,
Iſa. 66.Aſcends the Heavens high.

lg.head: LXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the raging Sea,
So throwing out her filth,
Makes me to mind the wicked's Life,
Iſa. 57.With pity in their mirth.

lg.head: LXVI.
lg.l: When I the Scarlet fine do ſee,
So Curious and Red,
Makes me to mind that Rachab's Sign,
Joſh. 2.Was by a Scarlet Thread.

lg.head: LXVII.
lg.l: When I behold the Field in May,
So pleaſant and ſo green,
Makes me to mind that glory ſtill,
That Saints enjoy in Heaven.

lg.head: LXVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Boughs ſo green,
To ſpread themſelves by Well,
Makes me to mind that fruitful Branch,
Gen. 49.Of Joſeph over Wall.

lg.head: LXIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Serpent crawl,
On Belly as a Slave,
Makes me to mind its puniſhment,
Gen. 3.Since it deceived Eve.

lg.head: LXX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Water run,
That hath her Banks ſo torn,
Makes me to mind that Reuben right,
Gen. 49.That was to Jacob born.

lg.head: LXXI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Fire burn,
With Colours Red and Blue,
Makes me to mind how it conſum'd,
Levit. 30. Nadab and Abihu.

lg.head: LXXII.
lg.l: Now when the Meadow's full of Gra ••
It's pleaſant to be ſeen,
Makes me to mind our David right,
Pſal. 23.With all his Paſtures Green.

lg.head: LXXIII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Black-bird ſing,
In the Month of May,
Makes me to mind the pleaſant Song
That Saints do ſing alway.

lg.head: LXXIV.
lg.l: Into us happily the Lines,
In pleaſant places fell,
Becauſe our Goſpel firmly ſtands,
Pſal. 16.Againſt the Gates of Hell.

lg.head: LXXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee Profeſſors fair,
With every Wind to ſhake,
Makes me to mind that Demas guilt,
2 Tim. 4.That did the Truth forſake.

lg.head: LXXVI.
lg.l: When I the Tiles on Houſes ſee,
With all their crooked forms,
Makes me to mind how Luther bold,
Went to the City Wormes.

lg.head: LXXVII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Oxen Low,
And Bleating of the Sheep,
Makes me to mind ſuch Sacrifice,
2 Sam. 15.As Saul of Agag kept.

lg.head: LXXVIII.
lg.l: When I do hear them Curſe and Sw •••
Such Oaths would tear thy Sky,
Makes me to think our God's moſt 〈◊〉
Rev. 24.Does not in Hell them tye.

lg.head: LXXIX.
lg.l: When I the Sun on Dial ſee,
It does my fancy raiſe,
How it went backward Ten Degrees,
2 King. 20.On the Dial of Ahaze.

lg.head: LXXX.
lg.l: When I am tempted from Day to Day,
With Enemies Mercileſs,
Makes me to mind my Saviour dear,
Luke 4.How in the Wilderneſs.

lg.head: LXXXI.
lg.l: When I do drink the water clear,
That's in the River Tweed,
Makes me to mind that River ſtill,
Rev. 22.That does the Saints ſo feed.

lg.head: LXXXII.
lg.l: When I behold the Chickens young,
And Hen their kindly Mother,
How carefully her Wings ſhe ſpreads,
Them from all harm to cover;
Makes me to mind that Offer great,
Matth. 23.Which Chriſt did give our Mother.

lg.head: LXXXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Swallow ſwift,
So quick in Motion fly,
Makes me to mind my time ſo quick,
Poſts to Eternity.

lg.head: LXXXIV.
lg.l: O who art thou great Pharaoh's Hoſt,
Will not obey our King?
Before to Morrow-day be light,
Exod. 15.Thou'lt find another thing.

lg.head: LXXXV.
lg.l: When I the Hony-ſuckle ſee,
With all her Paps ſo fine,
How ſhe does feed the induſtrious Bee,
Which makes her Honey mine.

lg.head: LXXXVI.
lg.l: When I behold the glorious Stars,
From Heaven downward fell,
Makes me to mind proud Lucifer,
Like lightning's dropt to Hell.

lg.head: LXXXVII.
lg.l: When we the Poor hear at the Door,
That cannot help themſel,
Let us draw out our Bowels to ſuch,
Luke 16.Leſt we get Dives Hell.

lg.head: LXXXVIII.
lg.l: When I do mind the Loaves and Fiſher few
That fed ſo many Men,
Makes me to love my Maker dear,
Mat. 14,That does take care of them.

lg.head: LXXXIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the glorious Sun,
So Red do ſet at Even,
Makes me to mind thoſe Chariots Red,
That carries Martyrs to Heaven.

lg.head: XC.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Lilies fair,
That in the Vallies grow,
How pleaſant all their Garments are,
Math. 6.Of neither Flax nor Tow.

lg.head: XCI.
lg.l: When I the Saints Graves do ſee,
And Bones about them lye,
Makes me to mind Ezekiel's Days,
Ezek. 37.When more of them was dry.

lg.head: XCII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Salmons breed,
And their innumerable fry,
Makes me to praiſe my Maker good,
With his governing Eye.

lg.head: XCIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Wind-Mill clear,
And all her Sails ſo wide,
Makes me to mind that Grinder ſtrong,
Judg. 16.sWhich bruiſed the Philiſtines Head.

lg.head: XCIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Dew ſo thick,
That on the Oxen lye,
Makes me admire that Babyloniſh King,
Dan. 4.That once did ring ſo high.

lg.head: XCV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Peewits gay,
With their Top, and white Breaſts,
Makes me to mind that rouſing day,
2 King. 10. Jehu with Baa's Prieſts.

lg.head: XCVI.
lg.l: When I behold the Woods ſo Green,
So purely ſpread and ſmell,

Makes me to mind
•• hovah's praiſe,
That made them all himſel.

lg.head: XCVII.
lg.l: When I the Butter-fly do ſee,
With her brave painted Wings,
Makes me to mind my Maker great,
That did create all things.

lg.head: XCVIII.
lg.l: When I the Robin-Red-breaſt ſee,
That pretty Bird of fame,
Makes me to mind the Sons of Men,
Jam. 3.Whoſe Tongues can never tame.

lg.head: XCIX.
lg.l: When I the Honey-comb do ſee,
So Curiouſly wrought,
Makes me to mind my Maker's praiſe,
Who hath all Creatures taught.

lg.head: C.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Wheels ſo quick,
And all its Spokes to turn,
Makes me to mind that Fortune ſly,
Prov. 23.Whoſe Wings are on the Wind.

lg.head: I.
lg.l: WHEN I do ſee the Stars ſo clear
That were the Wiſemens guiding
Makes me to mind the glorious Night
Matth. 2.Brought Heaven & Earth glad-tyding •

lg.head: II.
lg.l: When I do ſee the glorious Stars,
In Number ſo excell,
Makes me to ſhow my Maker's praiſe,
Pſal. 47.That all of them do tell.

lg.head: III.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Bread ſo broke,
Communicants before,
Makes me to mind Chriſt's Body brok •
1 Cor. 11.Our Sins upon him bore.

lg.head: IV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the pleaſant Dew,
So thick on Graſs to fall,
Makes me to mind that Promiſe ſweet,
Hoſ. 14.As due to Iſrael.

lg.head: V.
lg.l: When I behold the Serpent right,
That Enemy of Man,
Makes me to mind that Propheſie,
Gen. 49.That's ſpoken of to Dan.

lg.head: VI.
lg.l: When I conſider Sheba's Queen,
Whom Solomon did behold,
With her moſt Noble Gifts to him,
1 King. 10.That was of beaten Gold.

lg.head: VII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Weeds ſo thick,
Amongſt the Corn that grow,
Makes me to mind that wicked Crew,
Mat. 13.Amongſt God's Plants that flow.

lg.head: VIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Birds on Earth,
So plenteouſly to breed,
Makes me to mind my Maker good,
Mat. 6.Them every one does feed.

lg.head: IX
lg.l: When I do ſee the Oxen ſtrong,
So calm in Yoke does draw,
Shall I not love the Yoke of Chriſt,
That keepeth me in aw.

lg.head: X.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Embroiderers Gold,
And all his works ſo clear,
Makes me to mind the glorious Robes,
Pſal. 45.Kings Daughters are to wear.

lg.head: XI.
lg.l: When I the Doves among the Rocks,
So carefully do ſpy,
Ought not the Doves of Chriſt much more,
Cantic. 2.Fly to their Rock moſt High.

lg.head: XII.
lg.l: When I do drink the Water clear,
That comes from Trinity Well,
Makes me to mind thoſe Perſons Three,
1 John 5.That all in One do dwell.

lg.head: XIII.
lg.l: When I am by the Bee ſo ſtung,
That all my Face do ſwell,
Makes me to hate theſe Roaring Devil
1 Pet. 5.8.Would ſting us all to Hell.

lg.head: XIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Hornets thick,
That does our Beaſts ſo ſting,
Makes me to mind their Plague ſo ſore
Joſh. 24.Who drove the Amcrites King.

lg.head: XV.
lg.l: When I the Leviathan ſee,
That in the Water plays,
Makes me to magnifie my God,
Pſal. 104.That made her for his praiſe.

lg.head: XVI.
lg.l: When I the Behemoth do ſee,
Which does all Beaſts excell,
Makes me to praiſe fehovah High,
Job 4.Which did Create them all.

lg.head: XVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sky ſo clear,
And Sun ſo bright excell,
Makes me to mind thoſe glorious Heave •
Where Saints ſo many dwell.

lg.head: XVIII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Black-bird ſing,
Warbling her pleaſant chants,
Makes me to long to ſee that Day,
I'll ſing in Heaven with Saints.

lg.head: XIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the quaking Aſp,
Continually to ſhake,
Makes me to mind thoſe Conſcience guile
Gen. 4.Made Cain and Judas quake.

lg.head: XX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the loving Mother,
Preſerve her Child from harms,
Makes me to mind my Savior dear,
Mark 10.Who bieſs'd them in his Arms.

lg.head: XXI.
lg.l: When I do hear the Winds ſo loud,
With its Rebounding ſound,
Makes me to mind thoſe Treaſures great,
Prov. 30.God in his Hand hath bound.

lg.head: XXII
lg.l: When I do ſee the Fox-tree Leaves,
And all her beauteous Bells,
Makes me to mind the glorious Robes,
Exod. 28.That Aaron wore with Bells.

lg.head: XXIII.
lg.l: O let us thankful be to God,
For good things we poſſeſs,
Leſt turns the Scale of Providence,
Deut. 28.And Enemies us Oppreſs.

lg.head: XXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Fire burn,
And all its ſmoke expell,
Makes me to thank my glorious Lord,
Delivers Saints from Hell.

lg.head: XXV.
lg.l: A Wood-Picker.When I that pleaſant Bird do ſee,
With Colours deck'd ſo fine,
Makes me to mind the Rainbow right,
Gen. 9.To us that is a Sign.

lg.head: XXVI.
lg.l: When I the Truth ſee ſore oppreſt,
And Providences dark,
Makes me to mind that Ichabod,
1 Sam. 4.When Philiſtines took the Ark

lg.head: XXVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Wicked Men,
That ſins with ſuch deſire,
Makes me to mind the Swine ſo Vile
2 Pet. 2.That wallows in the Mire.

lg.head: XXVIII.
lg.l: When I the Rocks and Mountains ſe •
Upon the Earth ſo tall,
Makes me to mind the wickeds wi ••
Rev. 6.Upon them all to fall.

lg.head: XXIX.
lg.l: When I the Trading Chap-men ſee,
That Travels thro' each Land,
Makes me to mind how that of Old,
2 Chr. 9.They brought Gold to Solomon's 〈◊〉

lg.head: XXX.
lg.l: When I do ſee our Bodies fine,
Yet come to Death we muſt,
Makes me to mind both firſt and la ••
Gen. 3.They are but very Duſt.

lg.head: XXXI.
lg.l: When I do ſee them throw the ſton ••
And hit the Mark ſo even,
Makes me to mind theſe wicked Cr ••••
Acts 7.That ſtoned our Glorious Stephen

lg.head: XXXII.
lg.l: When I do hear the Trumpet clear,
My fancy does effect,
Makes me to mind how Angels ſou •
Macth. 24.When gathers the Elect.

lg.head: XXXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Bread ſo white,
Our Food that is ſo clean,
Makes me to mind the Baker right,
Gen. 40.And Butler with their Dream.

lg.head: XXXIV.
lg.l: When I the Cock at Morn do hear,
That Crows ſo pleaſantly,
Makes me to mind that Apoſtle great,
Matth. 26.That did his Lord deny.

lg.head: XXXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sabbath broke,
And people play ſuch tricks,
Makes me to mind the puniſhment,
Num. 15.Of him that gather'd ſticks.

lg.head: XXXVI.
lg.l: When we are drunk to morrow next,
I think we're worſe than Beaſt,
That drinks no more of water clear,
Pſal. 104.Than fully quench its thirſt.

lg.head: XXXVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Rocks ſo high,
And Goats that on them climb,
Makes me to mind that Scape-goat high,
Levit. 16.That takes away my Sin.

lg.head: XXXVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sun beams ſhine,
So brightly through the Clouds,
Makes me to mind that glorious Day,
Matth. 24.When Chriſt comes thro' as Judge.

lg.head: XXXIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the water clear,
And Fiſh ſo pleaſant play,
Makes me to mind that Ocean deep,
John 1.That waſh my Sins away.

lg.head: XL.
lg.l: When I the Catter-pillars ſee,
So thick on Trees to cling,
Makes me to mind that Plague of them,
Pſal. 105.That fell on Egypt's King.

lg.head: XLI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Stump of Trees,
So pleaſantly to ſpring,
Makes me to mind Nebuchadnezzar high,
Dan. 4.That Babyloniſh King.

lg.head: XLII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Ocean great,
That ſtill does ebb and flow,
Makes me to mind that myſtery great,
That no Man living know,

lg.head: XLIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Beelzebub,
That porſonous, naſty fly,
Makes me to hate great Beelzebub,
Eph. 6.That caſts his Darts ſo ſly.

lg.head: XLIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Sea ſo rough,
And all her Waves hears Roars,
Makes me to love my Maker kind,
Job 38.That keeps her in at Doors.

lg.head: XLV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Stones ſo thick,
That on the way do lye,
Makes me to mind that ſtone ſo great,
Matth. 21.Makes Men to Powder fly.

lg.head: XLVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Nonſuch Flower,
For all it is ſo fine,
Yet I do love the Lilly more,
Pſ. 127.3.Becauſe ſhe's granted mine.

lg.head: XLVII.
lg.l: When I the Saints Graves do mind,
That formerly I have ſeen,
Makes me to long that glorious Day,
We'll meet again in Heaven.

lg.head: XLVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Marygold,
The Clover, and Sun's-flower,
How carefully they open and ſhut,
According to its Hour:
An Emblem to Watch and Pray,
Matth. 24.That knows not our Son's Hour.

lg.head: XLIX.
lg.l: When I the Cockhead Red do ſee,
That grows amongſt the Corn,
Makes me to mind that dreadful Night,
Exod. 12.Of Egypt her firſt-born.

lg.head: L.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Blood ſo Red,
That cometh from the Lamb,
Makes me to mind that Glorious Night,
Exod. 12.Of Iſrael's Paſchal Lamb.

lg.head: LI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Oak ſo great,
That's found in the Moſs Band,
Makes me to mind that Noah's Flood,
That caus'd 'em there be fande.

lg.head: LII.
lg.l: When I do ſee them cleave the Wood,
They in the Fire burn,
Makes me to mind that Offering,
Gen. 22.Of Abraham with his Son.

lg.head: LIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Ship ſo ſwift,
And all her Sails ſo clean,
How ſhe the water quick does ſhed,
To her deſired Haven:
Makes me to mind thoſe Holy Saints,
Phil. 3.In Motion quick for Heaven.

lg.head: LIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Feet of Men,
Upon the Aſhes go,
Makes me to mind how Feet of Saints,
Malach. 3.Shall tread the wicked low.

lg.head: LV.
lg.l: Though all the World go after Sin,
As Daniel ſaw full well,
Who rather than offend his God,
Dan. 6.Choſe Lions Den to dwell.

lg.head: LVI.
lg.l: When I am hungry and ſo faint,
And cannot help my ſel,
Yet I'll believe in God my King,
In whom all fulneſs dwell.

lg.head: LVII.
lg.l: When I behold the Milk white Swan
Of all the Fowls the Queen,
Makes me to mind thoſe pure Whi •• Robe ••
Rev. 7.That Saints do wear in Heaven.

lg.head: LVIII.
lg.l: When I go thro' the Thorns ſo thick
That does my Clothes ſo tear,
Makes me to mind that Crown of them
John 19.My Saviour did wear.

lg.head: LIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee thoſe Garments fine,
Our Gallantries do wear,
Makes me to mind that Garment gay
Joſhua 7.Coſt Achan's Life ſo dear.

lg.head: LX.
lg.l: When I am wet with Rain ſo thick,
I am in ſorry Mood,
Makes me to mind that Rain ſo great
Gen. 7.That did begin the Flood.

lg.head: LXI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Snail ſo ſlide,
And Houſe upon her Back,
Makes me to mind that Emblem fair,
1 Tim. 5.What care we ought to take.

lg.head: LXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Husband-man,
The Land to Plow and Sow,
Makes me to mind that Seed of Grace,
Which God in Hearts do Sow.

lg.head: LXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Chryſtal clear,
That's beautiful and clean,
Makes me to mind the Sea of Glaſs,
Rev. 4.That's ſpoken of in Heaven.

lg.head: LXIV.
lg.l: When I do Wade the Water deep,
And feel it is ſo Cold,
Makes me to mind that Ocean deep,
Exod. 14.That Pharaoh found of Old.

lg.head: LXV.
lg.l: When I do hear the Thunder loud,
Sees Fire like a Flame,
Makes me to mind that Storm ſo great,
Gen. 19.That Sodom overcame.

lg.head: LXVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Spider's Web,
How ſhe does catch the Flies,
Makes me to mind thoſe Sectaries fly,
Iſa. 59.Would catch us as they pleaſe.

lg.head: LXVII.
lg.l: When I the Bees on Flowers do ſee,
So careful for their Hive,
Should we not careful Chriſtians be,
That would for ever thrive.

lg.head: LXVIII.
lg.l: When I do mind that Haman great,
On Gallows high to ſwing,
Makes me admire that Providence,
Eſther 7.Of my Eternal King.

lg.head: LXIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Flocks ſo thick,
That Shepherds bring to Fold,
Makes me to mind that Shepherd fine,
1 Sam. 17.That David was of Old.

lg.head: LXX.
lg.l: When I do hear the wicked mock,
Thoſe that God ſo fears,
Makes me to mind Eliſha's Curſe,
2 King. 2.Performed by the Bears.

lg.head: LXXI.
lg.l: When I conſider Zion's caſe,
Tho' ſhe be brought ſo low,
Yet I will mind thoſe Mercies Bowels,
Iſa. 51. To her do overflow.

lg.head: LXXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Widows poor,
That feareth God moſt high,
Makes me to mind their promiſe ſure,
Iſa. 54.That's ſpoken in Iſaiah.

lg.head: LXXIII.
lg.l: When I the Chaff before the Wind,
So quickly ſees give way,
Makes me to mind the Wicked Race,
Pſal. 1.So quickly flees away.

lg.head: LXXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Aſſes ſmall,
Thoſe Creatures that's ſo ſtrong,
Makes me to mind thoſe Judges great,
Judg. 5.White Aſſes rode upon.

lg.head: LXXV.
lg.l: When I a pleaſant Horſe do ſee,
That pretty Creature tall,
Makes me to mind King Solomen,
1 King. 4.Had Forty thouſand ſtall.

lg.head: LXXVI.
lg.l: When I do mind that Elim fine,
With her Wells and Palm-trees,
How to the weary Iſraelites.
Exod. 15.She gave refreſhing eaſe.

lg.head: LXXVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Dagger clear,
So dangerous a thing,
Makes me to mind it ſhath'd ſo deep,
Judg. 3.In Belly of Moab's King.

lg.head: LXXVIII.
lg.l: When we are dipt in ſtraits ſo deep,
Can no Evaſion ſee,
Then let us mind his ſtrength for help,
God All-Sufficient.That's called Ell-Shads.

lg.head: LXXIX.
lg.l: When I think on the Palm-tree fine,
So Beautiful and Green,
Makes me to mind the Righteous ones,
Pſal. 92.So flouriſhing to Heaven.

lg.head: LXXX.
lg.l: When I do find the Rain ſo thick,
Sees Waters great to grow,
Makes me to mind that Noah's Flood,
Gen. 7.The Earth did overflow:

lg.head: LXXXI.
lg.l: When I do walk the Road along,
And not a Penny of Money,
A ſmall refreſhment unto me,
1 Sam. 14.Is like to Jonathan's Honey.

lg.head: LXXXII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Birds ſo catch'd
And taken in a Gin,
Makes me to mind that Emblem right,
Eccleſ. 9.When we are ſnar'd in Sin.

lg.head: LXXXIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Godly rare,
That's in Affliction ſoure,
Yet I will mind thoſe Angels kind,
Pſal. 34.That Guards them every Hour.

lg.head: LXXXIV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Worldly-proud,
In Sins Career go on,
Makes me to mind our general calls,
1 Pet. 2.To them a ſtumbling ſtone.

lg.head: LXXXV.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Adder deaf,
That cloſely ſtops her Ear,
Makes me to mind the wicked Crew,
Pſal. 58.No Goſpel-Charms will hear.

lg.head: LXXXVI.
lg.l: When I conſider David King,
Whoſe Houſe ſuch Troubles fand,
Yet I will mind his Covenant,
2 Sam. 25.That ſhall for ever ſtand.

lg.head: LXXXVII.
lg.l: When I the Flocks on Mountains ſee,
And Shepherds them to turn,
Makes me to mind that Moſes fine,
Exod. 3.When he the Buſh ſaw burn.

lg.head: LXXXVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Doves ſo White,
Thoſe pretty pleaſant things,
Makes me to mind our David fine,
Pſicl. 55.That wiſh'd he had ſuch Wings.

lg.head: LXXXIX.
lg.l: That Sons of God are now begun,
From Scripture proof is clear,
And God himſelf at the laſt Day,
1 John 3.Shall make it full appear.

lg.head: XC.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Righteous,
With trouble from wicked meet,
Yet I will mind that Day to come,
Pſal. 58.His Blood ſhall waſh his Feet.

lg.head: XCI.
lg.l: God an Eternal Refuge is,
To thoſe that are his own,
And the Everlaſting Arms underneath,
Deut. 33.Shall fully to them be ſhown,

lg.head: XCII.
lg.l: When I thoſe pleaſant Blooms do ſee,
Upon our Peaſe that's Green,
Makes me to mind the Garments fine,
Rev. 18.When Babylon ſat as Queen.

lg.head: XCIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Bees ſo thick,
About the Hive that's flying,
Makes me to mind that ſwarm of them,
Judg. 14.In Carcaſs of a Lion.

lg.head: XCIV.
lg.l: When I do drink the Water fine,
From Moffat-Well that fa,
Makes me to mind that Pool for Health,
John 5.That was at Betheſda.

lg.head: XCV.
lg.l: When I behold the Turky-flower,
So largely ſpread it ſel,
Makes me to mind his Dominions great,
Where once the Saints did dwell.

lg.head: XCVI.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Spaniard proud,
For all his Silver Mines,
Yet I my Climate would not change,
In which the Goſpel ſhines.

lg.head: XCVII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Flower-de-luce,
And its Blew ſtinking Flower,
Makes me to mind Saints Blood its ſhed
Rev. 6Cries Vengeance every Hour.

lg.head: XCVIII.
lg.l: When I do ſee the Trees ſo thick,
As I do walk the Road,
Makes me to mind thoſe fooliſh Men,
Iſa. 44.That makes of them a God.

lg.head: XCIX.
lg.l: When I do ſee Idolaters,
Which on Falſe Gods do call,
For which I mind that ſpoiling great,
Judg. 2.God ſent on Iſrael.

lg.head: C.
lg.l: When I the Government do mind,
By which our Church now ſtands,
Wiſh God the like may planted be,
Thro' all Earth's utmoſt Lands.

lg.head: CI.
lg.l: In Scotland my Firſt Breath I drew,
My Lines ſo pleaſant fell,
Pſal. 16.By thoſe in Africa that be,
And Aſia that dwell.

div.p: Reader, I wiſh you as much Joy in Reading theſe Verſes, as I had in Making them on a Seven Hundred Miles Journey on Foot.
